translation.value: Yes, I want to leave this level!
Yes, I want to delete this savegame!
Yes, I want to load a previous saved game!
FPS limit when game is not in focus
Enable cursor clipping (only available in windowed mode)
Enter menu when game is not in focus
This is an enemy creature, details are unknown.
Your creature is sleepy, make sure you have enough beds available.
Your creature is hungry, make sure you have enough food at the bar.
Your creature is thirsy, make sure you have enough beer at the bar.
Make sure there is an empty bed available for him to be transported too and regain his consciousness.
This is an enemy building, details are unknown.
You can either fetch the fluid or build a bridge over it.
Click on the fluid to order your imps to fetch it.
Either build a mine or dig in this area to get the minerals.
Reinforce your walls to make it harder for enemies to dig through them.
Sells a building. You will only get a part of the building materials back.
Opens a menu with wall constructions to build.
Opens a menu with floor constructions to build.
Opens a menu with nature objects to build.
Opens a menu with minerals to add.
Opens a menu with minerals to remove.
Opens a menu with creatures to add.
Link or unlink rooms to alter their delivery paths.
Manually activates or deactivates a building.
Opens a menu with rooms to build.
Opens a menu with bar room buildings.
Opens a menu with bed room buildings.
Opens a menu with cookery room buildings.
Opens a menu with catacombs room buildings.
Opens a menu with farm room buildings.
Opens a menu with metalworks room buildings.
Opens a menu with prison room buildings.
Opens a menu with storage room buildings.
Opens a menu with training room buildings.
Opens a menu with trading room buildings.
Opens a menu with spells to cast.
Possess a creature and make him do your bidings.
Reveals a hidden area of land to you.
Opens a menu with actions to do with fluids.
Order your imps to drop a water block on a tile.
Order your imps to drop a lava block on a tile.
Fetch a water or lava block for future storage.
Build a road to connect your rooms and decrease your creatures travel time.
Upgrade a road to decrease your creatures travel time.
Show details about the selected creature.
Show details about the selected room.
Opens a menu with hydraulics to build.
Opens a menu with hydraulic switches to build.
Opens a menu with hydraulic traps to build.
Lists items that can be found naturally in the dungeon and don't need to be crafted in a production chain.
Lists items that can only be produced by combining other items in a production chain.
Lists items that can be consumed by creatures.
Lists equipable weapons and other items that can be crafted and used for inflicting damage on enemies.
Lists equipable armors and other items that can be crafted and used for defending against enemy attacks.
Lists available trades that can be made in exchange of gold.
Lists building that can be built on different types of fluids.
Trading will take place between trading rooms and claimed portals. The more portals owned the more trading options will be available.
Click the (+/-) button to set the trading condition.
Left-click to zoom in on active trades.
This trade is locked! Unlock trades by claiming portals to the surface world.
If more than %s2 units of %s1 are stored then start selling %s1 for gold.
If less than %s2 units of %s1 are stored then start buying %s1 for gold.
No trading condition have been set for %s1.
Sell if more or equal than %s1
Conquer all the human spawning portals in the dungeon.
Catch a fish by building a bridge out to a school of fish.
Unlock and build all rooms types.
Make a trade with other collonizations.
Level up an impanzee to learn the creature skill barrel roll.
Level up an cyclotaur to learn the creature skill bull rush.
Level up an piggeh to learn the creature skill butchering.
Level up an fishman to learn the creature skill frog tongue.
Level up an knight to learn the creature skill hurricane.
Level up an rogue to learn the creature skill steal.
Level up an orc to learn the creature skill stunning block.
Level up an imp to learn the creature skill teleport.
You can edit the squads from the creature menu.
Click to remove the flag from the dungeon.
Pressing '%d' or left clicking on this icon will give you the option to put down a rally flag in the dungeon that all battle ready creatures will go to. This is the least prioritized flag.
Pressing '%d' or left clicking on this icon will give you the option to put down a squad flag in the dungeon. Any creature that are bound to this squad will prioritize this flag before any other.

Left clicking on this icon will give you the option to put down a creature flag in the dungeon that any creature of this type will go to. This flag is more prioritized than the rally flag but less than the squad flag.
Next to all player owned territory
Click below to add or remove crafting orders.
Not craftable without the 'Forge and Anvil'!
(Click the upper bar to switch quick-item)
Shows what race this creature belongs to.
Shows the level of this creature and how much experience is needed before the creature reaches the next level.
Shows the efficency this creature currently have. A low efficency will lower the creature's damage, defense and resistance. The efficency is affected by if the creature's needs get saticfied.
Show the damage this creature can do per second. The value shown is the attackspeed multiplied with the damage.
Shows the defense this creature currently have. A high defense will help the creature withstand physical attacks.
Shows the resistance this creature currently have. A high resistance will help the creature withstand elemental attacks.
Shows the health this creature currently have. If the health goes down to zero the creature will die.
Shows how well rested this creature currently is. If rest value gets too low it will affect the creature's efficency and finally make the creature turn against you.

Shows how full the creature is. If the creature gets too hungery it will affect the creature's efficency and finally make the creature turn against you. Giving the creature its favourite food will increase the creature's efficency.
This creature don't have any favourite food.
Shows how drunk this creature currently is. If the creature starts sobering up it will affect the creature's efficency and finally make the creature turn against you.
Shows what the creature currently is doing.
Destroying human buildings on the surface world will feed the evil meter.
I hope you liked playing Dwelvers.
If you want to support the development of this game and
be able to play the full version you can visit www.dwelvers.com
Dwelvers is a game that is being continuous updated, by pre-ordering the game you receive all
future updates and help us reach our goal to make Dwelvers the game it deserves to be!
This room does not need workers.
This is a non-playable preview of the upcomming surface world!
A new item has become available for production
This area is unexplored, details are unknown.
Click on creature to feed to the Dark Mother:
Click on quickicon to make a swap.
Feed enemies to the Dark Mother
How prioritized it is for creatures to be assigned to rooms. This prioritization is based upon how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
How prioritized it is for creatures to train. This prioritization is based upon how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.

How prioritized it is for creatures to sleep. They will always want sleep when they are tired. But beware, a lower priority can make them do higher priority tasks first if they are available even when the creature is unhappy because of the lack of sleep. This prioritization is constant and is not affected by how many others are doing the same task.
How prioritized it is for creatures to dig. This prioritization is based upon how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
How prioritized it is for creatures to build and transport items to building-site. This prioritization is based upon how many creatures are building at the moment.
How prioritized it is for creatures to claim new territory. This prioritization is based upon how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
How prioritized it is for creatures to store items that is laying around outside the rooms. This prioritization is based upon how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
How prioritized it is for creatures to fetch water from wells. This prioritization is based upon how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
How prioritized it is for creatures to fish. This prioritization is based upon how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
How prioritized it is for creatures to transport wounded allies. This prioritization is based upon how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
How prioritized it is for creatures to imprision enemies. This prioritization is based upon how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
How prioritized it is for creatures to feed enemies to the Dark Mother. This prioritization is constant and is not affected by how many others are doing the same task.

How prioritized it is for creatures to eat and drink. They will always want eat and drink when they are hungry or sober. But beware, a lower priority can make them do higher priority tasks first if they are available even when the creature is unhappy because of their starvation or low alcohol level. This prioritization is constant and is not affected by how many others are doing the same task.
How prioritized it is for creatures to maintain traps. This prioritization is based upon how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
How prioritized it is for creatures to equip new weapons and armor. This prioritization is based upon how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
How prioritized it is for creatures to do miscellaneous tasks that are not listed above. This will option will only be available in the early access version of the game.
How prioritized it is for creatures to reinforce walls. This prioritization is based upon how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
How prioritized it is for creatures to gather at the rally flag. This prioritization is constant and is not affected by how many others are doing the same task.
A battle has broken out in the dungeon
One of your creatures have engaged in battle, zoom in on the location and use the rally flag to send reinforcements to help your creature out.
One of your creatures is hungry

Make sure that you have enough food to keep your creatures well feed. You'll also need a bar table with chairs built next to it so they have somewhere to eat. If you choose to ignore this your creatures will starve.
One of your creatures is tired
Make sure you have a bedroom with an appropriate bed for the creature. If your creatures don't get any rest they will get grumpy and turn against you.
One of your creatures is thirsty

Make sure that you have enough beer to keep your creatures drunk. Some of your creatures need beer to function, which you can produce with a brewery. You also need a bar table with chairs built next to it so that they have somewhere to sit. If you choose to ignore this your creatures will get grumpy and ignore your orders.
Your storage rooms are full, and to solve the problem you need to build more storage rooms with tables and shelves so that you have somewhere to store your items.
One of your rooms has no open area for a room flag to be put down. Solve this by expaninding the room or selling a building in it.
One of your buildings have has attacked
One of your buildings have been attacked, zoom in on the location and use the rally flag to send reinforcements to protect the building.
One of your buildings is blocked. Make sure that the building has enough room around it to be able to function properly.
One of your buildings requires but cannot find a clear path to a portal. If this is not solved within one minute the trade that requires the free path will be canceled.XXXX

This twisted root vegetable can be grown and harvested in the farm land in the farm room. It has the same properties as wheat and needs water to grow, but as an advantage it can survive without sunlight. It is perfect for underground farming and its main uses include making beer or flour.
A standard barbarian axe made from steel and wood. It is heavy to wield but has high damage.
A standard barbarian shield made from steel, wood and bones. Despite its small size it is very heavy, and for those that are able to wield it can enjoy its high block chance.
A standard barbarian sword made from steel and wood. This weapon is lighter than the axe but so is its damage because of its low quality.

This sweet beer is made out of water and antroots and brewed in the cookery room. Make your imps serve it at the bar so that you can raise the alcohol level of your dungeon drunks and make them happy.
A twisted sword that delivers unexpected attacks against even the most experienced fighters.
A piece of bone obtainable from enemies and butchered animals. It is mainly used as a crafting material.
This bone armor is made out of bone and rope and can resist strong attacks. It is a very popular armor when going into battle as its appearance brings fear into the enemy's eyes.
This bone axe is made out of bone and ropes. Its weak damage is the proof that bones should not be used in weapon making.

Food in its simplest form, a simple side dish for some, but down here in the darkness it is a delicacy. This bread is made out of flour and water and can be baked in the cookery room at the baking table. Serve it at the bar to still the hunger of your minions so that they can keep on working and do your biding.
Ammunition for your cannon traps, highly effective when not pointing your way!
Once a useful tool for butchering animals, now a weapon that is used to practice the same skills on its enemies.
Coal, a mineral of fossilized carbon that is used primary in the metal works room as an energy source. This mineral is easy to find as it can be mined out of every layer in the dungeon.

Who does not love to eat a raw splattering fish taken right out of its watery homeland? Serve it as it is at the bar to still your minions hunger. It turns out that your imps are excellent fisherman as long as they have something steady to stand on. So build them a bridge out to a shoal of fishes and they will do the rest for you.
The flour is grinded from antroots in the mill in the farm room, its primary used for making bread in the cookery room.

It is a dense, soft, malleable, and ductile metal with an attractive, bright yellow color and luster that is maintained without tarnishing in air or water. To find gold you will need to dig deep and take advantage of the natural cliff formations in the dungeon.
A simple hide armor that hardly brings any protection at all. Can be worn by almost any creature.

Iron is one of the most common elements in the dungeon next to coal. It is rarely seen directly at the surface but is not hiding too many layers down either. As it is contaminated by dirt and rock it needs to be purified in the iron smelter in the metal works room before it can be used.
An armor made out of steel, rope and leather. It has a high defence but is very heavy. Only the strongest creatures are able to wear it and take advantage of its benefits.
A simple fistweapon made out of steel and wood that brings devastating punches to the enemies.

A steel ingot is an item that has been cast into a suitable shape for further processing. It is made out of iron and coal in the iron smelter at the metal works room. It is mostly used as a building material and in the blacksmith.
This mighty two handed weapon is primarly crafted for human knights and used to keep the threat of the underworld at bay.
A piece of leather obtainable from the butcher. It is mainly used as a crafting material.
A simple leather armor that brings some protection against enemy attacks. Can be worn by almost any creature.
An alive mouse that can be used in the farm mill wheel.
A tool used by peasants for harvesting the land. Can also be used as weapon as long as nothing better comes along.
Serve it at the bar to still your minions hunger.
Serve it at the bar to still your minions hunger.

This is a resource you will get whether you want it or not. Just start digging in the dungeon and rocks will fall to the ground for your imps to pick up. Just make sure that you have the storage capacity for it. Rocks are just as common a building material as wood, but if you get enough rocks you may just be able to build something extra.
A simple rope that can be gained by chopping down roots. It is mainly used as a crafting material.
Despite its simple apparence it is a very dangerous weapon against those that makes its wearers angry. It is made out of wood, ropes and steel.

For some reason water is the easiest resource to get in the dungeon, but that is lucky for you because the production chain would fail without it! Just build yourself a well and let your imps fetch water from it.

Not many thought that it would be possible to harvest wood in a dungeon. But as it turns out, great trees are growing on the surface and their roots stretch far down through the dungeon cracks. Order your minions to harvest the roots so that you get the invaluable wood and are able to construct useful buildings in your dungeon.
This wooden club is a stick with a rock on it. A simple and an effective killing tool, but don't expect it to knock down a troll!
This is a simple wooden shield which gives the wearer some block chance. It is very cheap to produce and can be life saving.
Drills and lives in the rock.
A legendary creature with the strength of a bull and the depth perception of a cyclops.
Half man, half fish, half brain. A sneaky creature that fears nothing.
A little green tierless creature that keeps your dungeon up to order.
A territorial creature made from the unholy mixture of an imp and a chimpanzee.
A human front line warrior that are known for his high health and sweeping attacks.
A fierce warrior with a constant need to work.
A strong creature with a passion for food.
This is a greedy and sneaky being that no one ever should turn his back against.
Dark Mother Room, also called Hellgate Room. This room works as a the head quarter for all your minions.
A portal that connects the surface world with the dungeon.
A place where your workers can fetch water.
A place for your creatures to eat and drink.
A road that enables quicker transportation. This road can be upgrade three times.
A reinforced wall that takes long time to dig through.
A room were food and drinks are being made.
Here is where the farming takes place.
A resting place for the dead.
Concentrate your defense by building guardrooms.
Remnants of a room that now have been taken over by impanzees.
A standard seamless floor used in mazes to confuse visitors.
A solid maze wall that can not be dug out.
A room for all kind of metal constuctions.
Needed to keep your enemies in place.
A solid rock wall that can not be dug out.
This Impanzee Statue is a tribute to the impanzees and rises their moral in the dungeon.
This Orc Statue is a tribute to the orcs and rises their moral in the dungeon.
Items stored here will be claimed as yours.
Used for trading goods with other collonizations.
A bridge with a arc shaped apparence.
A fireplace designed for the bedroom.
All chests are filled with items that your workers can claim.
A baking table used for making bread.
Used for barbecuing fish and delicious mouse meat.
Wall barrels designed for the cookery room.
An ordinary wall torch that lights up your dungeon.
This wooden door will somewhat protect your dungeon against intruders.
A farm land used for growing and harvesting antroots.
A gate for the farm land.
Fishes that can be used as food if caught by your workers.
Produces weapons and armors from iron and other resources.
A gate that leads into the graveyard.
A barrel used for storage in the Dark Mother room.
When it gets pressure it will fire a flaming cannonball in the direction the cannon is facing.
Every time pressure reaches the counter it will switch on and off allowing pressure to pass through or not.
Gives off a gigantic explosion destroying walls, foes and friends nearby when it gets pressure.
Gives pressure in one direction unless it gets pressure from another.
Excellent for trapping enemies and kill them off.
Used to transport pressure between the different hydraulics constructions.
When steped on by an enemy it will deliver pressure to its surroundings.
Only enables pressure in one direction, very good for creating loops.
An hydraulics that switches the pressure on and off.
Produces iron ingots from coal and iron ores.
Prison bars made for keeping your enemies locked in.
A floor torch made out of a decapitated arm.
A wall torch made from a skull.
A good practice pig for your melee fighters.
Produces clothing out of rope and leather.
A stone bridge that can resist lava.
A corner shelf for storing items on.
A crosstable for storing items on.
A round table for storing items on.
A shelf for storing items on.
A square table for storing items on.
A wall shelf for storing items on.
A loadingdock used for trading with other collonizations.
An ordinary wooden bridge that keeps the creatures from falling into the water.
A ladder that enables your creatures to reach new heights.
A place for you minions to sit down and drink.
A bed designed for cyclotaurs only.
A bed designed for the fishman only.
A bed designed for imps only.
A bed designed for impanzees only.
A bed designed for orcs only.
A bed designed for the piggeh only.
A patch of magical glowing mushrooms.
An war insignia made for increasing the creatures moral in the dungeon.
Build on a mineral vein to extract more minerals but during a longer timespan.
A colorful painting that can decorate one of your dungeon walls.
A pine tree that can be chopped down to get wood.
A solid fence designed to keep intruders at bay.
A dart board for training ranged fighters.
Ordinary trees that can be chopped down to get wood.
An ordinary wall lantern that lights up your dungeon.
